intro: Callerya cinerea, commonly known as the silver callerya, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant features pale green to silver-gray foliage that gives it its common name. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Callerya cinerea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
